This is the best modern emulator for NES, very precise, and the flatpak runs excellent.
I had issues with crashing when loading a ROM. However, installing straight from the official Fedora repo, no issues.
It works but keep in mind to not use fullscreen mode because it disables the menu and there is no shortcut key to return to windowed mode. I've tried F11 and Alt+Return and they didn't work.

no support for coins
no support for modern controllers
NEStopia is very minimal but it works and it plays NES games as well as any other emulator I've seen. I would recommend installing retroarch and retroarch-nestopia if you want something better.
Very simple to use, no issues, works out of the box.
allowed me to select a rom but I tried multiple working roms and it would crash everytime
summary: did not work at all. Crashes

description: There are some audio issues (i hear "scratching" sounds if that makes sense). I cannot get out of fullscreen

the windows versions is just 10000000000000000000000000000000 times better

the emulator itself is pretty decent, played battletoads well without any sort of visual or audio errors. only issue I have with it is the fullscreen functionality, theres no way to exit fullscreen what so ever.

Audio issues.

Working well

Runs a tad slow on a Dell Latitude e5570 at 2560x1440, 32GB RAM, Ubuntu 20.04, but nothing terrible. As I find more options (e.g. screen coverage down to 80% already made the game very playable, reduced 3d effects a tad, and if I can find a resolution option - or maybe change system display lower - this should improve.) 

Thanks!
It works great!
summary: I'm very thankful to the developers

description: Video works ok, but the sound would go in and out so often it sounded "scratchy" like another reviwer said. Video works fine and would be playable if it were not for the sound issue.

I've used this emulator for years on windows and it always worked perfectly. On Ubuntu 22.04 though, the inputs defaulted to turbo inputs even when I had the turbo inputs set to totally different buttons, and on controller the inputs did whatever they wanted and did not honor my configuration. While I was trying to sort out the inputs it started spamming random buttons and the emulator crashed. I would like to reitterate that I used NEStopia on windows and it always worked flawlessly.

i've been using nestopia at windows and i have never have a problem. recently im trying ubuntu and try this nestopia. somehow i notice the direction move control kinda auto turbo hyper tapping on its own when i hold down the button... which is op for playing tetris but horrible for playing literally everyhing else, especially platformers like megaman and metroid
if you want to use fullscreen exit by pressing esc.

description: If you try to set the emulator on fullscreen, it fails, only change the window size. Better try to make a flatpak of PuNES a better, modern and convenient NES emulator.
